description: You can’t help but appreciate the company ing a book give her such incredible powers? For all you of a fighter, since his approach to life is so much like know, she could be in league with some dark deity, so her yours. He is a staunch ally in battle and a friendly rival ability to toss around fireballs won’t earn her any respect outside it. The fighter has more options and tricks than from you until she takes the time to explain how she you do in combat, but you’re often the more formidable does it. At that point, maybe you can move beyond your foe, especially while you’re raging. In addition, you have basic mistrust of the unknown and begin to form a per- a wider array of skills than he does, so you have the ad- sonal connection with her. vantage over him in wilderness exploration. None of this hurts your friendship, though. A little competition is a Choosing When to Rage good thing, after all. “Sometimes my mind just gets in the way. Sometimes not.”
name: Fighters

description: If you have an opposite number, it has to be —Krusk the monk. Your zest for life and focus on reality are dia- metrically opposed to her philosophy of withdrawal The barbarian’s rage is limited in both duration and fre- from the world. You have no trouble expressing your quency, so the question of when to activate it is an im- opinions, but she’s terribly reserved—she must either be portant tactical decision. But the considerations change afraid of something or be too stifled to show her feelings. as the barbarian gains levels and has more opportunities Other people claim that your approach to life and hers to rage. are both valid, but you think she’s simply wrong. You The low-level barbarian can rage only once or twice don’t worry much about her choices, though, as long as per day, so he must use the ability wisely. One option is she doesn’t try to impose them on you. to save his rage for the combat that he guesses to be the

In the typical dungeon, it’s off the battlefield, the two of you seldom see eye-to-eye. often obvious when the party is facing or about to face You hate restrictions, and she, of course, is rigidly lawful the toughest villain. In this case, it makes sense to rage as as well as good. You tend to set aside social niceties and soon as the battle begins. The faster the enemies can be get right to the heart of a situation; she wastes time with eliminated, the less damage they do, and the fewer party platitudes and negotiation. Even in combat, the two of resources must be expended in the battle. Unless the you sometimes differ in your approaches. Whereas the barbarian’s Constitution score is especially low, his rage paladin considers her foes’ actions in a moral sense and should last long enough to finish even the toughest fight tries to protect the weak, you simply want to crush your ot the day. enemies and to see them driven before you. description: A character drinking this potion gains an intuitive empathy with animals (in the form of a +10 circumstance bonus on Handle Animal checks) for 1 hour. An imbiber with ranks in Animal Empathy also gains a +10 circumstance bonus on Animal Empathy checks.
name: Animal Logic

description: A character drinking this potion gains a +10 circumstance bonus on Wilderness Lore checks for 1 hour.
name: Natural Clarity

description: A character drinking this potion gains a +10 circumstance bonus on Intuit Direc- tion checks for 1 hour.
name: Unerring Direction

description: These boots grant the wearer a +4 circumstance bonus on checks for performing any physical action that extends over a period of time, such as running, swimming, or breath-holding. The wearer also gains a +4 circumstance bonus on Fortitude saves to avoid subdual damage caused by exposure to heat or cold, and a +4 circumstance bonus on Constitution checks made to prevent subdual damage from thirst or starvation.
name: Boots of Endurance
